p: Fig 3 shows that both model (1) and model (2) fit the DF cases reasonably well during the training process. Our results indicate that the fit of model (1) and model (2) were both found to be significant ( F = 10.46, P<0.001). The value of model with the DBSI (GCV:7.62 and Deviance explained: 99.23%) fit better than the model without DBSI (GCV: 18.41 and Deviance explained: 94.53%). Moreover, the effects of climate, imported cases and DBSI were found to be significant at the 0.05 level ( S4 Table). The one-week ahead predictions of dengue outbreaks that occurred from the 45 th week to the 52 nd week of 2014 for both models are shown in Fig 4. Model (2) gives a better prediction of DF cases (ICC:0.94 and RMSE:59.86) than model (1) (ICC:0.72 and RMSE:203.29).
